protocol_name: Glycolysis Stress Test for Monocyte Glycolytic Function
protocol_name_html: Glycolysis Stress Test for Monocyte Glycolytic Function

materials.reagent_name: 0.1M sodium bicarb buffer pH 8.0 sterile filtered
Pipettes and P1000 P200 P10 tips

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"atpfl","text":"Add 50 \u03bcl medium to wells A and H and 50 \u03bcl cells to wells B-G.  Samples are generally run in duplicate or triplicate on each plate.  Cell number is 1.5\u00d710^5 cells per well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"34A2CA40CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672594,"previous_guid":"346461B0CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Procedure"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93m4i","text":"Place plate in the carrier and place in centrifuge.  Spin 300\u00d7g for 1 minute without brake.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jbfh","text":"Add 130 \u03bcl assay medium to each well A-H (final volume 180 \u03bcl).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cd3tm","text":"Incubate plate at 37oC in non-CO2 incubator for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":20,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":32,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"34A429D0CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672597,"previous_guid":"34A3B4A0CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Procedure"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"chlm7","text":"Prepare preliminary drug dilutions (mix by pipetting up and down)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"kol2","text":"100 mM glucose (blue cap) - add 300 \u03bcl medium","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"258ap","text":"50 \u03bcM oligomycin (light blue cap) - add 288 \u03bcl medium","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rulu","text":"500 mM 2-deoxyglucose (green cap) - add 300 \u03bcl medium - vortex 1 minute","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"34A56250CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672599,"previous_guid":"34A450E0CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Procedure"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ftmbp","text":"Prepare final drug dilutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eefmc","text":"100 mM glucose - use as-is","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72ufm","text":"10 \u03bcM oligomycin - 120 \u03bcl of 50 \u03bcM oligomycin in 480 \u03bcl medium","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5oatn","text":"500 mM 2-deoxyglucose - use as-is","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"353A4F50CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672603,"previous_guid":"34A56250CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Procedure"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6dsqt","text":"Remove sensor cartridge from incubator and remove and reinsert sensors briefly to clear air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bjmbl","text":"Fill cartridge:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"171fp","text":"Port A (all wells): 20 \u03bcl glucose (10 mM final concentration)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"75jbo","text":"Port B (all wells): 22 \u03bcl oligomycin (1 \u03bcM final concentration)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bkc7l","text":"Port C (all wells): 25 \u03bcl oligomycin (2 \u03bcM final concentration)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9i3nh","text":"Port D (all wells): 27 \u03bcl 2-deoxyglucose (50 mM final concentration)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dipei","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"5mi01","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"201jv","text":"We do two separate injections of oligomycin, although one seems to work (although less consistently).  If one injection is desired, prepare oligomycin so that final concentration after the first injection is 2 \u03bcM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"353CC050CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672608,"previous_guid":"353BFD00CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Procedure"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bpff","text":"Select Glycolysis Stress Test program on Seahorse XFp and calibrate sensor cartridge (remove lid).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ccqmt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"gr3s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"8lrdi","text":"If two oligomycin injections are used, a custom program will need to be run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"353D0E70CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672609,"previous_guid":"353CC050CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Procedure"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"csmea","text":"After 1 hour cell incubation, remove utility plate from XFp and insert cell plate (remove lid).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"efm5a","text":"Run Assay.  3 measurements per injection (including basal) is sufficient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3bg3","text":"After run is completed, image each well by photomicroscopy or collect and isolate protein from each well to normalize cell numbers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f3tp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"chu4u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"35D333F0CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672612,"previous_guid":"35744B10CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Procedure"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4k9nj","text":"Data can be analyzed in the following manner.  Averages or min\/max for each condition can be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"29tq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7c4r0","text":"Glycolysis: (glucose ECAR) - (2-deoxyglucose ECAR)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":10,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bmqq3","text":"Glycolytic Capacity: (oligomycin ECAR) - (2-deoxyglucose ECAR)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":19,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cj23m","text":"Glycolytic Reserve: (oligomycin ECAR) - (glucose ECAR)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":18,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61vh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1f1p2","text":"Calculations are depicted in Figure 1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3jj2c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"13g2q","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"5olvo","text":"Figure 1. Calculations for Glycolysis Stress Test.Notes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"63kfd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"30894","guid":"A69E0510CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/8fqh4nn.jpg","placeholder":"","original_name":"gst.jpg","mime":"image\/jpeg","width":null,"height":null,"is_video":false}}],"guid":"63835EB0CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672615,"previous_guid":"35D333F0CB3111E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Data Analysis"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bednh","text":"Turn on XFp analyzer to warm up overnight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"155md","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ft6l","text":"Hydrate XFp sensor cartridge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cg9g4","text":"    Add 200 \u03bcl XF calibration solution (included with FluxPak) to each well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6q7ss","text":"    Add 400 \u03bcl sterile PBS or H2O to each moat. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":31,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2ri4e","text":"    Incubate overnight at 37oC in non-CO2 incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":28,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":40,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eeq0d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"2C7A5C60CB3211E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672616,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Day Prior to Assay"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dv43f","text":"Seahorse DMEM Media","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":19,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bltq5","text":"Add 50 \u03bcl pyruvate, 50 \u03bcl L-glutamine, to 5 ml Seahorse Base Medium. Sterile filter before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a7ltu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b33q1","text":"Cell-Tak coated XFp plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"enfqa","text":"Prepare Cell-Tak. Add Cell-Tak and sodium hydroxide to 0.1 M sodium bicarbonate so that each well will receive 0.56 \u03bcg Cell-Tak, and sodium hydroxide concentration will be 0.63 mM. Cell-Tak concentration varies by batch, so calculations for each new batch will need to be performed. Add 25 \u03bcl Cell-Tak solution to each well. Plate can be stored at room temperature (at least 20 minutes) until use (for a few hours). Plates can also be prepped prior to assay day by incubating plates in Cell-Tak (at least 20 minutes), then aspirating remaining solution, air drying, and storing at 4oC until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":582,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"qu03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ovqc","text":"Monocytes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":9,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"covm2","text":"Monocytes should be prepared as directed in the monocyte isolation protocol. Isolated monocytes should be diluted to a concentration of 3\u00d7106 cells \/ ml in prepared Seahorse DMEM media prior to use in the assay. Use monocytes immediately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":140,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"5F7DE690CB3211E8B5048375910FCA8D","id":672617,"previous_guid":"2C7A5C60CB3211E8B5048375910FCA8D","section":"Materials to Prepare"}
